body:
FYI, #3095 is purely doc related (code of conduct).

While the proposed changes might be contentious to some, it is hard to imagine any plausible technical reason for why the changes would lead to failure in the classification module...

One more, also on mac: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/runs/7523631638

All classification related, maybe that's another possible lead? @MatthewMiddlehurst ?
Mac failures might be related to macos-10.15 being deprecated https://github.com/actions/virtual-environments/issues/5583 I'll make a PR to bump the OS version of the CI host.

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.

A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->

body: This seems to be affecting #3090 as well for a range of classifiers and transformers. Most of the failures have been untouched for quite a while as far as I am aware.
I have an explanation for 14 workers, @lmmentel: they are not concurrent, but sequential. One after another, the workers crash, so `pytest-xdist` spins up new ones in an attempt to try again.

issue.title: [ENH] metrics rework part IV - hierarchical metrics

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR continues rework of the current metrics interface.

This PR uses the tests in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2496 and builds upon #2500 and #2502

The following changes are made relative to #2502:

* extending `BaseForecastingErrorMetricFunc` to accept hierarchical input
* enable averaging options via the `multilevel` parameter

issue.title: [ENH] filter transformer from `sktime-neuro`

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Experimental: moves the filter transformers from `sktime-neuro` into sktime.

Changes:
* adds `mne` as a soft dependency
* now inherits from `BaseTransformer` and implements `_transform`
* the `kwargs` in `__init__` are changed to an argument, to ensure interface compliance (no init kwargs)
* the `sktime` `BaseTransformer` no longer distinguishes between series or panel input, so both `FilterForSeries` and `FilterForPanel` are simply moved to a single transformer

FYI @SveaMeyer13

This is a diagnostic PR to investigate https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/3103

If the theory is correct that recent migrations in the GitHub cloud are the culprit, this should fail. Otherwise, it would pass.

issue.title: [MNT] revert recent CI changes

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Update: CI does not fail on this, compared to current PR where almost always sth fails. This indicates that we have probably identified a change condition, even if not the root cause.

This indicates that revert will fix the issues, until the point where we understand the root cause better.

---
This is a diagnostic PR to investigate https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/3103

Purpose: see whether the tests complete when these recent changes to CI are reverted:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2896
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/3107

If the theory is correct thatsaid changes are the culprit, this should pass. Otherwise, it would fail.

body:
Revert of recent CI changes seems to fix the issues, see #3118.

The recent changes that are reverted consist of three things:

* testing notebooks on py 3.9, not 3.7, by @fkiraly 
* codecov-action changed from version 2 to version 3, by @miraep8 
* merging separate linux and mac CI elements into a single matrix, by @lmmentel

My suspicion is towards the merge of linux/max since it appears as the most substantial change, but we cannot rule anything out at the moment imo.

E.g., there could be a bug in codecov that ends up eating memory.
